name: lidlss
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clss, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆ c2)
⊣ c2 =(Base `(ringLMod ` c3))
⊣ c1 =(LSubSp `(ringLMod ` c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clss, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆ c2)
⊣ c2 =(Base `(ringLMod ` c3))
⊣ c1 =(LSubSp `(ringLMod ` c3))

stmt.origin: eqtri(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(crglmod, c3)), cfv(cbs, c3))

body.origin:
|- wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wceq(cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(cbs, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
body.pretty:
⊢ c2 =(Base `(ringLMod ` c3))
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ (Base ` c3)=(Base `(ringLMod ` c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clss, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wceq(cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(cbs, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆ c2)
⊣ c1 =(LSubSp `(ringLMod ` c3))
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ (Base ` c3)=(Base `(ringLMod ` c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clss, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆ c2)
⊣ c1 =(LSubSp `(ringLMod ` c3))
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)

stmt.origin: eqtri(c1, cfv(clss, cfv(crglmod, c3)), cfv(clidl, c3))

body.origin:
|- wceq(c1, cfv(clss, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clidl, c3))
-| wceq(cfv(clidl, c3), cfv(clss, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
body.pretty:
⊢ c1 =(LSubSp `(ringLMod ` c3))
⊣ c1 =(LIdeal ` c3)
⊣ (LIdeal ` c3)=(LSubSp `(ringLMod ` c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clidl, c3))
-| wceq(cfv(clidl, c3), cfv(clss, cfv(crglmod, c3)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆ c2)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ c1 =(LIdeal ` c3)
⊣ (LIdeal ` c3)=(LSubSp `(ringLMod ` c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clidl, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆ c2)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ c1 =(LIdeal ` c3)

comment: An ideal is a subset of the base set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Mar-2015.)
